title: Black Coffee to sit down with Trevor Noah on 'The Daily Show'
text:
Black Coffee to sit down with Trevor Noah on 'The Daily Show' share this

Johannesburg – Renowned local artist Black Coffee is getting ready to take a seat opposite Trevor Noah on as they chat on The Daily Show.

The DJ is listed on the Comedy Central website as one of the upcoming guests on the US late-night show.

"My Ancestors wildest dreams," Black Coffee wrote on Twitter when he shared the news with his fans along with a screengrab from the Comedy Central site.

Black Coffee is not the only South African to chat with Trevor on The Daily Show set, in July famed artist Nelson Makamo, whose work was featured on TIME magazine's "Optimist Issue" in February, also got the chance to sit down with the comedian on the show.

Black Coffee has collaborated with both local and international artists, including Hugh Masekela, Nakhane Toure, Alicia Keys, Usher, Monique Bingham and David Guetta

The award-winning and globally-acclaimed producer will make his debut on The Daily Show on Tuesday at 22:00 CAT on Comedy Central Africa (DStv 122).



Aside from his upcoming appearance on The Daily Show, Black Coffee also tweeted a picture of himself with rapper Drake at a gig in Canada.

The SA muso really does stay winning.
